title: Micron Stock Falls Because Earnings Guidance Misses Estimates
text:
Micron Technology stock is losing ground in late trading Thursday after the memory-chip company provided disappointing profit guidance for its fiscal first quarter ending in November, citing caution on the economy and global trade issues.

For the fiscal fourth quarter ended Aug. 29, Micron (ticker: MU) posted revenue of $4.87 billion, down from $8.44 billion, but ahead of the Street consensus estimate for $4.57 billion. Non-GAAP profits were 56 cents a share, ahead of the Street consensus estimate for 49 cents.

...
description: The memory-chip maker’s stock is losing ground in late trading Thursday after Micron provided disappointing profit guidance for its fiscal first quarter ending in November, citing caution on the economy and global trade issues.
